subject: Re: [junit] Query on JUnit usage.
msgSnippet: Suresh, I m sorry no one has responded to this question yet.  As a matter of fact, Eclipse itself is tested using JUnit.  For example, see
messageBody:
Suresh,

I'm sorry no one has responded to this question yet. As a matter of
fact, Eclipse itself is tested using JUnit. For example, see

http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1.2-200601181600/testframework.html

or the book _Contributing to Eclipse_. Good luck,

David Saff

vg_suresh wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am new to JUnit tool. All i understand from the web sites that is
> available on JUnit is, it is unit testing tool.
>
> Actually we are using Rational Functional Tester automation tool
> which supports JUnit framework.
>
> We are testing an IDE which is developed using eclipse3.1
>
> My query is whether we can test the IDE which is developed on
> eclipse using JUnit.
>
> Or in what ways can i use JUnit to test my IDE.
>
>
> Thanks in Advance,
>
> Regards,
> Suresh
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
